revised_title: Xylem-Transported Chemical Signals and Their Role in Regulating Plant Growth and Physiology
tldr: The article discusses the role of xylem-transported chemical signals, particularly abscisic acid (ABA), in regulating plant growth and physiology under drought stress. The authors provide evidence that ABA, synthesized in roots, moves through the xylem stream to the shoot, providing a measure of the plant's water access in the soil. This signal can influence leaf growth, stomatal conductance, and other aspects of shoot physiology, helping plants adapt to water scarcity.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Physiology
